body_html:
One gotcha to avoid is to make sure GPU outputs are real-valued, since integer tensors on GPU don't seem to be supported (register_types.h)

// Call "m" on all types supported on GPU.
#define TF_CALL_GPU_NUMBER_TYPES(m) \
  TF_CALL_half(m) TF_CALL_float(m) TF_CALL_double(m)

#define TF_CALL_GPU_NUMBER_TYPES_NO_HALF(m) TF_CALL_float(m) TF_CALL_double(m)
body_text:
One gotcha to avoid is to make sure GPU outputs are real-valued, since integer tensors on GPU don't seem to be supported (register_types.h)
// Call "m" on all types supported on GPU.
#define TF_CALL_GPU_NUMBER_TYPES(m) \
  TF_CALL_half(m) TF_CALL_float(m) TF_CALL_double(m)

#define TF_CALL_GPU_NUMBER_TYPES_NO_HALF(m) TF_CALL_float(m) TF_CALL_double(m)
body:
One gotcha to avoid is to make sure GPU outputs are real-valued, since integer tensors on GPU don't seem to be supported ([register_types.h](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/a304537954a865752ad1b18461e6bd67b36082db/tensorflow/core/framework/register_types.h))

```
// Call "m" on all types supported on GPU.
#define TF_CALL_GPU_NUMBER_TYPES(m) \
  TF_CALL_half(m) TF_CALL_float(m) TF_CALL_double(m)

#define TF_CALL_GPU_NUMBER_TYPES_NO_HALF(m) TF_CALL_float(m) TF_CALL_double(m)

```
